options.text: Some bacterial cell may have copy number of plasmids vary from 15-100
Vector should have many recognition sites for commonly used restriction enzymes so that alien DNA can attach to any one of the sites easily.

<math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mrow></msup></math>  gene in pBR322 can be cleaved by Pvu I and Pst I.

solution.text: Vectors in biotechnology process is a carrier for the genetic material to transfer to the desired organism's genome. Vectors are also used for making copies or clones. Origin of replication (ori) in a vector enable replication of the vector and vector supporting higher copy number is preferred. Some bacteria have been known to have copy number of plasmids from 15-100. Vector having a selectable marker is preferred as it will help in identifying the transformant from non-transformants. Vector with few or single restriction enzyme sites preferred to avoid fragmentation of the DNA sequence and reduce complication of the biotechnological process. Plasmids and bacteriophages are preferred as cloning vectors from transferring gene. pBR322 is one of the most used plasmids which has the tetracycline resistant gene  <math><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></math>  which has restriction site for enzyme BamH I.
